review.body:
With a sandbox account on device. But I don't know any way how to reproduce the issue related to the silent failure in `SKPaymentQueue.finishTransaction()`. It happened a couple of times during testing, usually it looks like two transactions with the same transaction ID appear with the "purchased" status on the payment queue, typically the second (repeat) transaction arrives briefly after a call to `finishTransaction()`.

> *[Reviewable](https://reviewable.io/reviews/mullvad/mullvadvpn-app/5371#-:-NhkuJlF8eNm8Ov0swqR:btp430v)* status: 4 of 6 files reviewed, 5 unresolved discussions



<!-- Sent from Reviewable.io -->

pull_request.title: Prevent handling already processed transactions ios-365
pull_request.body: This PR introduces a transaction log to keep track of already processed transactions and prevent handling the same transaction more than once. It turned out that a call to `SKPaymentQueue.finishTransaction()` may silently fail and then pump the same transaction back on the queue. When that happens we shouldn't upload the AppStore receipt again, instead we should only attempt to finish such transaction immediately. Transaction log introduced in this PR stores transactions IDs in the text file as a list of newline separated strings. It is made to be thread safe in anticipation that the payment manager could be taken off the main queue and into background queue to offload the main thread, but I didn't want to go into heavy refactoring, nor introduce more asynchronous code paths. Hopefully that should be satisfactory given that transaction log is going to be relatively slim and do very little I/O. Besides that I took care of documenting a lot of stuff in the payment manager to make it easier to review code and improve documentation coverage. - - - This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/mullvad/mullvadvpn-app/5371)

pull_request.title: Move access method testing logic to `mullvad-daemon`
pull_request.body: Move access method testing logic to `mullvad-daemon`, which means that the implementation details of how the test works is opaque to whatever frontend which wants to issue a test of some (configured) access method. - - - This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/mullvad/mullvadvpn-app/5370)

nit
Super mega tiny nitpick.

A dictionary is not necessarily a hash map.

*[`ios/MullvadVPN/StorePaymentManager/StorePaymentManager.swift` line 67 at r2](https://reviewable.io/reviews/mullvad/mullvadvpn-app/5371#-NhknEFO2cBEri8B0Sre:-NhknEFO2cBEri8B0Srf:bri777x) ([raw file](https://github.com/mullvad/mullvadvpn-app/blob/57c8b432115ad99bb7387f094d4fdcf0bc0b10f0/ios/MullvadVPN/StorePaymentManager/StorePaymentManager.swift#L67)):*

Is this missing self intentional ?

It turned out that a call to `SKPaymentQueue.finishTransaction()` may silently fail and then pump the same transaction back on the queue. When that happens we shouldn't upload the AppStore receipt again, instead we should only attempt to finish such transaction immediately. Transaction log introduced in this PR stores transactions IDs in the text file as a list of newline separated strings. It is made to be thread safe in anticipation that the payment manager could be taken off the main queue and into background queue to offload the main thread, but I didn't want to go into heavy refactoring, nor introduce more asynchronous code paths. Hopefully that should be satisfactory given that transaction log is going to be relatively slim and do very little I/O. review.body:
> Reviewed 1 of 1 files at r4, all commit messages. > *[Reviewable](https://reviewable.io/reviews/mullvad/mullvadvpn-app/5367)* status: all files reviewed, 4 unresolved discussions (waiting on @buggmagnet) ___ *[`ios/MullvadSettings/MigrationManager.swift` line 89 at r1](https://reviewable.io/reviews/mullvad/mullvadvpn-app/5367#-NhfrMyA3eAcw1LZCNd9:-NhkN8Xs0l_zgU-4BVNg:b2n8f6n) ([raw file](https://github.com/mullvad/mullvadvpn-app/blob/a379f24bce4661a1dc84bc403345e7e17abf1d57/ios/MullvadSettings/MigrationManager.swift#L89)):*
Previously, buggmagnet wrote…
I'm not sure what to answer. Those variables are reused in the `repeat` loop to incrementally upgrade the settings. How would you write this ?
`guard var savedSchema` and `var savedSettings` would eliminate the need for both `versionTypeCopy` and `latestSettings`. ___ *[`ios/MullvadSettings/SettingsManager.swift` line 36 at r1](https://reviewable.io/reviews/mullvad/mullvadvpn-app/5367#-Nhg-TBQ24WSP9ziAXrD:-NhkOlETCngdvlTPx4F_:bagh5tr) ([raw file](https://github.com/mullvad/mullvadvpn-app/blob/a379f24bce4661a1dc84bc403345e7e17abf1d57/ios/MullvadSettings/SettingsManager.swift#L36)):*
Previously, buggmagnet wrote…
Ideally we shouldn't have to do this, but since `SettingsManager` is architectured to be globally available it's complicated to use it, or use any components that depend on it in tests. I didn't want to refactor `SettingsManager` so this is the 2nd best approach I could think of to avoid changing it, but still make it safely usable in tests.
Well, I tried my own suggestion and it seems `ApplicationSecurityGroupIdentifier` is nil at the time of unit test setup, so that clearly didn't work... ___ *[`ios/MullvadSettings/TunnelSettings.swift` line 16 at r2](https://reviewable.io/reviews/mullvad/mullvadvpn-app/5367#-NhfsoNP1qPJfEIPtL2_:-NhkPdYh8nYP2wQ6E_X-:bp72j2n) ([raw file](https://github.com/mullvad/mullvadvpn-app/blob/6c7c2999a8431e68df4044f951ca9d9bba3cf8dd/ios/MullvadSettings/TunnelSettings.swift#L16)):*
Previously, buggmagnet wrote…
You are correct. I wanted to get the team's feeling on that, happy to remove all the currently unused arguments.
I'll let the others chime in, but I don't think we should keep them. ___ *[`ios/MullvadVPNTests/MigrationManagerTests.swift` line 127 at r1](https://reviewable.io/reviews/mullvad/mullvadvpn-app/5367#-NhgAG2W-_hrLuwlNrx9:-NhkEXlm7RTekZtSiOyp:bu56oo6) ([raw file](https://github.com/mullvad/mullvadvpn-app/blob/a379f24bce4661a1dc84bc403345e7e17abf1d57/ios/MullvadVPNTests/MigrationManagerTests.swift#L127)):*
Previously, buggmagnet wrote…
Not sure what you mean by that. `TunnelSettings` do not provide a version attached to it. Do you mean that we should include the version in the `TunnelSettings` protocol ?
We could do something like the snippet below to determine version instead. It's not super elegant, but that way we don't need to specify version twice att call, ie `migrateToLatest(TunnelSettingsV1)`, reducing potential discrepancies and bugs. _Code snippet:_ ```Swift switch settings { case is TunnelSettingsV1: [...] ```

pull_request.title: Migrate settings to Version3 and introduce incremental migration scheme.
pull_request.body: This PR introduces a version 3 of the settings that includes UDP over TCP obfuscation settings. This PR also introduces back the migration scheme. I took a couple of decisions in this PR that we already discussed beforehand, but for the sake of documentation - We do not handle a special migration from V1 to V2 anymore, because there's a very low chance we still have users running on settings V1. - V1 to V2 upgrade is just taking the compatible settings forward (such as DNS options and Relay Filter) # Open question How do we want to handle version downgrade ? That's mostly a question for ourselves since users cannot downgrade the app. I decided to go for nothing to migrate, but we can also trigger a reset of the settings. I think it wouldn't be convenient for us though. This PR is mostly done, but there is some refactoring I want to do in `MigrationManager` to avoid reading the settings twice for example. - - - This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/mullvad/mullvadvpn-app/5367)

commits.message: Separate update of protocol and port

issue.title: Fix inability to set location constraint to 'any'
issue.body:
This also removes the `RelaySettingsUpdate` type.

Fix DES-432.

comment.body:
DES-432 Cannot set location to `any`

In the management interface, setting the relay location to `any` has the same effect as not specifying a location in `RelaySettingsUpdate`, i.e. none. This is probably a regression due to [DES-367](https://linear.app/mullvad/issue/DES-367/replace-wrapper-messages-in-proto-file-with-optional-modifier). This can be seen in some of the e2e tests, as the location is not reset: [https://github.com/mullvad/mullvadvpn-app/actions/runs/6633970508/job/18022645941#step:3:1567](https://github.com/mullvad/mullvadvpn-app/actions/runs/6633970508/job/18022645941#step:3:1567) This can be used as an opportunity to remove the `RelaySettingsUpdate` message/enum.

pull_request.title: Fix inability to set location constraint to 'any'
pull_request.body:
This also removes the `RelaySettingsUpdate` type.

Fix DES-432.

commits.message: Use snake case for serialized access methods
Prevent iOS from stopping the tunnel if it remains in connecting state for too long

Make username+password authentication optional in SOCKS5 remote configuration

SOCKS5 optionally supports username+password authentication, which has
been implemented previously. This commit addresses a bug in the argument
parsing, which made username+password required arguments when adding a
remote SOCKS5 api access method using `mullvad api-access add socks5
remote`.

Apparently, this is a known pitfall with `clap`: https://github.com/clap-rs/clap/issues/5092
Expose ownership and provider for relays

Previously, dlon (David Lönnhager) wrote…
I guess "rolling back" is not exactly what's happening -- it never switched to begin with.
That is technically true, but do you have any suggestion on how we should clarify for the user that `new_access_method` won't be used, and that the previous `current_access_method` will keep being the active access method? Is it clear enough to just say "Could not reach the Mullvad API using access method "? :blush: ___ *[`mullvad-daemon/src/lib.rs` line 2352 at r1](https://reviewable.io/reviews/mullvad/mullvadvpn-app/5370#-NhgXW7m4hMiXNK2Jgsw:-NhkE3RN479sXQFvM8Qk:b-fyv66w) ([raw file](https://github.com/mullvad/mullvadvpn-app/blob/aa84d80a36c5066c792aa0faad930bc1525b7af1/mullvad-daemon/src/lib.rs#L2352)):*
Previously, dlon (David Lönnhager) wrote…
Could we not allow both endpoints during the test?
If I understand the problem correctly, we would need to change how the handling of the firewall works, which is probably a bit out of scope. But that would be cleaner imo. ___ *[`mullvad-daemon/src/lib.rs` line 2372 at r1](https://reviewable.io/reviews/mullvad/mullvadvpn-app/5370#-NhgXC3Y5dmup5nZL2lY:-Nhga1mp8x10CgFky6lZ:b1b7t17) ([raw file](https://github.com/mullvad/mullvadvpn-app/blob/aa84d80a36c5066c792aa0faad930bc1525b7af1/mullvad-daemon/src/lib.rs#L2372)):*
Previously, dlon (David Lönnhager) wrote…
I wonder if we should really be blocking other commands while this is being fetched. To avoid blocking this channel, it would probably be nicer to switch to the new access method, spawn a request with `tokio::spawn`, and restore it once that completes.
That sounds reasonable!

pull_request.title: Move access method testing logic to `mullvad-daemon`
pull_request.body: Move access method testing logic to `mullvad-daemon`, which means that the implementation details of how the test works is opaque to whatever frontend which wants to issue a test of some (configured) access method. - - - This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/mullvad/mullvadvpn-app/5370)

commits.message: Prevent iOS from stopping the tunnel if it remains in connecting state for too long

Make username+password authentication optional in SOCKS5 remote configuration

SOCKS5 optionally supports username+password authentication, which has
been implemented previously. This commit addresses a bug in the argument
parsing, which made username+password required arguments when adding a
remote SOCKS5 api access method using `mullvad api-access add socks5
remote`.

Apparently, this is a known pitfall with `clap`: https://github.com/clap-rs/clap/issues/5092
Expose ownership and provider for relays
Fix app settings string resources capitalizations
Fix incorrect days on time left
Bump CI to Xcode 15.0.1 and stop specifying the exact version of iOS simulator
Add providers model and enable it in the daemon
Use snake case for serialized access methods
